Posts.EditableText:
Actually Davidw has a point, foriegn people speak better English than most people with English as a first language!

You can still tell how much effort that person has put into a message, even if they don't natively speak English, it somehow comes across in the message.
You should always spend alot of time thinking over what you have just written, to make sure it can be read well by others, or by the person you are sending the message to.

I always judge the quality of my messages on the amount of backspaces I hit. If it's alot then it's been well thought out - if not then it's either alot of code (which need's to be double-checked) or it's too perfect, and in need of a read-through.
